treatment.description: Perennials or subshrubs (in rock crevices). Involucres funnelform, campanulate, or hemispheric, 5–11 × 3.5–14 mm. Ray florets 0, or 3–5, or 6–18; corollas yellow. Disc florets 9–200; corollas yellow or white. Cypselae linear, linear-lanceolate, oblanceolate or oblong to oblanceolate, flattened, often obscurely rounded or angled on 1 or both surfaces, margins usually inconspicuously calloused and sparsely short-hairy; pappi 0 or of 1–2(–6) equal or subequal, smooth, antrorsely barbellulate, or subplumose bristles 0.5–4.6 mm plus callous crowns or hyaline scales. x = 17.

references.reference: Powell, A. M. 1973b. Taxonomy of Perityle, section Laphamia (Compositae–Peritylanae). Sida 5: 61–128.
